feed.title: ComputEEL/MatSci
feed.subtitle: ComputEEL/MatSci – Computational Materials Science group at EEL/USP (DFT, CALPHAD and materials properties).

entry.title: Our Nature Communications
entry.content:
With international collaborators, we published in Nature Communications reporting the mapping of the Lu–N–H system in the hunt for ambient superconductivity. The work combines first-principles calculations, structural analyses and experimental measurements.

Read the full article: 10.1038/s41467-023-41005-2.
entry.summary: With international collaborators, we published in Nature Communications reporting the mapping of the Lu–N–H system in the hunt for ambient superconductivity. The work combines first-principles calculations, structural analyses and experimental measurements.

entry.title: New group photo
entry.content:
We gathered the whole ComputEEL/MatSci group at the DEMAR entrance (EEL/USP) for the 2022 official photo. Always good to register the faces behind simulations, scripts and experiments.

Full team available in the Team section.
entry.summary: We gathered the whole ComputEEL/MatSci group at the DEMAR entrance (EEL/USP) for the 2022 official photo. Always good to register the faces behind simulations, scripts and experiments.

entry.title: P. P. Ferreira, the newest MSci. at Computeel

link.title: P. P. Ferreira, the newest MSci. at Computeel

entry.content: Pedro Pires Ferreira defended his MSc at ComputEEL/MatSci during the pandemic (with a proper “pandemic-style” official picture). Congrats, Mozão, for the journey and contributions in superconductivity and ab initio modelling!
entry.summary: Pedro Pires Ferreira defended his MSc at ComputEEL/MatSci during the pandemic (with a proper “pandemic-style” official picture). Congrats, Mozão, for the journey and contributions in superconductivity and ab initio modelling!

entry.title: Workshop Total Energy and Force Methods 2020

link.title: Workshop Total Energy and Force Methods 2020

entry.content: ComputEEL/MatSci took part in the Workshop Total Energy and Force Methods 2020, discussing numerical techniques and applications in materials. A great opportunity to present recent results and exchange experiences on calculation flows and validation.
entry.summary: ComputEEL/MatSci took part in the Workshop Total Energy and Force Methods 2020, discussing numerical techniques and applications in materials. A great opportunity to present recent results and exchange experiences on calculation flows and validation.

entry.title: P. P. Ferreira MSci. qualifying exam

link.title: P. P. Ferreira MSci. qualifying exam

entry.content: Pedro passed his MSc qualifying exam at ComputEEL/MatSci, moving into the final stretch of work on superconductors. Congrats on the milestone and the drive in research!
entry.summary: Pedro passed his MSc qualifying exam at ComputEEL/MatSci, moving into the final stretch of work on superconductors. Congrats on the milestone and the drive in research!

entry.title: New Master of Science in the group

link.title: New Master of Science in the group

entry.content: Thiago Dorini earned his Master’s degree with research developed at ComputEEL/MatSci. The committee included close supervision from the group and external guests. Congrats on the milestone and solid defense on thermodynamics and electronic properties!
entry.summary: Thiago Dorini earned his Master’s degree with research developed at ComputEEL/MatSci. The committee included close supervision from the group and external guests. Congrats on the milestone and solid defense on thermodynamics and electronic properties!

entry.title: 2nd Meeting - Technological Frontiers in Engineering
entry.content: Keeping the tradition from the first edition, we joined WorkChopp 2019 – Technological Frontiers in Engineering. The event mixed informal chats and presentations on technological frontiers in engineering and materials.
entry.summary: Keeping the tradition from the first edition, we joined WorkChopp 2019 – Technological Frontiers in Engineering. The event mixed informal chats and presentations on technological frontiers in engineering and materials.

entry.title: EOSBF2019
entry.content: Luiz T. F. Eleno and Igor Hideki presented work at the 2019 autumn meeting of the Brazilian Society of Physics, showing ComputEEL/MatSci results on materials properties and superconductivity.
entry.summary: Luiz T. F. Eleno and Igor Hideki presented work at the 2019 autumn meeting of the Brazilian Society of Physics, showing ComputEEL/MatSci results on materials properties and superconductivity.

entry.title: A. Manesco’s PhD qualifying exam
entry.content: Theoretical collaborator Antonio Manesco held his PhD qualifying exam at DEMAR/EEL-USP. A key milestone to consolidate his research in materials and move to the final thesis phase.
entry.summary: Theoretical collaborator Antonio Manesco held his PhD qualifying exam at DEMAR/EEL-USP. A key milestone to consolidate his research in materials and move to the final thesis phase.

entry.title: The ComputEEL/MatSci logo
entry.content: The ComputEEL/MatSci logo was created by Engineering Physics student Mateus Vallim, who kindly gifted the design to the group. The mark blends electronics and materials, guiding our identity across academic and digital materials.
entry.summary: The ComputEEL/MatSci logo was created by Engineering Physics student Mateus Vallim, who kindly gifted the design to the group. The mark blends electronics and materials, guiding our identity across academic and digital materials.
